senses.definition: to let someone have something as a present, or to provide something for someone

examples.text: What did Bob give you for your birthday?
examples.translation: 你生日鲍勃送了你什么？

examples.text: Researchers were given a £10,000 grant to continue their work.
examples.translation: 研究人员得到一万英镑的经费以继续他们的研究。

examples.text: I’ve got some old diaries that my grandmother gave me years ago.
examples.translation: 我有几本旧日记本﹐是多年前祖母给我的。

senses.definition: to put something in someone’s hand

examples.text: Give me the letter, please.
examples.translation: 请把信给我。

examples.text: He poured some wine into a glass and gave it to her.
examples.translation: 他倒了一杯酒递给她。

examples.text: Give me the letter, please.
examples.translation: 请把信给我。

senses.definition: to allow or make it possible for someone to do something

examples.text: He finally gave us permission to leave.
examples.translation: 他最后还是允许我们离开。

examples.text: These meetings give everyone a chance to express their opinions.
examples.translation: 这些会议给每个人发表意见的机会。

examples.text: Students are given the freedom to choose their own topics.
examples.translation: 学生有选择课题的自主权。

senses.definition: to tell someone information or details about something, or to tell someone what they should do

examples.text: She gave me some information on university courses.
examples.translation: 她向我提供了一些有关大学课程的信息。

examples.text: My secretary will be able to give you more details.
examples.translation: 我的秘书会告诉你更详细的情况。

examples.text: Let me give you some advice.
examples.translation: 我给你一些建议吧。

senses.definition: to do something by making a movement with your hand, face, body etc

examples.text: She gave a little frown.
examples.translation: 她轻轻皱了皱眉头。

examples.text: Joel gave me a smile as I walked in.
examples.translation: 我走进去的时候乔尔对我笑了笑。

examples.text: He gave her a big hug.
examples.translation: 他给了她一个大大的拥抱。

senses.definition: to make a speech, perform a piece of music etc for a group of people
senses.definition_cn: 发表〔讲话等〕﹔举行〔演出等〕

examples.text: He’s giving a talk on early Roman pottery.
examples.translation: 他要作一个关于古罗马早期陶器的报告。

examples.text: They gave one of their best performances to date.
examples.translation: 他们的这次演出是迄今为止最好的几场之一。

senses.definition: to make someone have a feeling

examples.text: He gave us quite a shock.
examples.translation: 他让我们十分震惊。

examples.text: The course has given me a lot more confidence.
examples.translation: 这门课程使我增加了不少信心。

examples.text: His job did not give him much sense of fulfilment.
examples.translation: 他的工作没有给他多少成就感。

examples.text: The new software has given us quite a few problems.
examples.translation: 这种新软件给我们带来不少问题。

examples.text: The new software has given us quite a few problems.
examples.translation: 这种新软件给我们带来不少问题。

senses.definition: to infect someone with the same illness that you have

examples.text: Don’t come too close – I don’t want you to give me your cold!
examples.translation: 别离我太近——我可不想让你把感冒传给我！

examples.text: It’s very unlikely a doctor could give HIV to a patient.
examples.translation: 医生把艾滋病病毒传染给病人的可能性极小。

examples.text: Don’t come too close – I don’t want you to give me your cold!
examples.translation: 别离我太近——我可不想让你把感冒传给我！

senses.definition: to organize a social event such as a party

examples.text: We’re giving a small party for dad’s birthday next week.
examples.translation: 下个星期爸爸生日﹐我们要为他举行一个小小的派对。

phrasal_verbs.definition: to give something to someone because you do not want or need it for yourself
phrasal_verbs.definition_cn: 分送﹐送掉〔不需要的东西〕

examples.text: I gave most of my books away when I left college.
examples.translation: 我大学毕业时把大部分书都送掉了。

examples.text: Give your old clothes away to a thrift shop.
examples.translation: 把你的旧衣服送去慈善商店吧。

examples.text: Give your old clothes away to a thrift shop.
examples.translation: 把你的旧衣服送去慈善商店吧。

phrasal_verbs.definition: to give something to the person it belongs to or the person who gave it to you

examples.text: This isn’t your money and you must give it back.
examples.translation: 这不是你的钱﹐你一定要还回去。

examples.text: Of course you can have a look at it, as long as you give it back.
examples.translation: 你当然可以看﹐但是你要还回来。

examples.text: I’ll give the keys back to you tomorrow morning.
examples.translation: 我明天早上把钥匙还给你。

phrasal_verbs.definition: to finally agree to do or accept something that you had at first opposed, especially because someone has forced or persuaded you to

examples.text: Eventually I gave in and accepted the job on their terms.
examples.translation: 最后我作出让步﹐按照他们的条件接受了这份工作。

examples.text: Bob’s wife went on at him so much that eventually he gave in.
examples.translation: 鲍勃的妻子对他不依不饶﹐他终于屈服了。

examples.text: The government refused to give in to their demands.
examples.translation: 政府对他们的要求拒不妥协。

phrasal_verbs.definition: to no longer try to stop yourself from doing something you want to do

examples.text: Don’t give in to the temptation to argue back.
examples.translation: 不要一时冲动就还嘴。

examples.text: If you feel the urge for a cigarette, try not to give in to it.
examples.translation: 如果烟瘾上来﹐要尽量克制。

phrasal_verbs.definition: if you give of yourself, your time, your money etc, you do things for other people without expecting anything in return

examples.text: Retired people are often willing to give of their time to help with community projects.
examples.translation: 退休老人常常愿意抽出时间来给社区项目帮忙。

phrasal_verbs.definition: to produce a smell, light, heat, a sound etc

examples.text: The wood gave off a sweet, perfumed smell as it burned.
examples.translation: 木头燃烧时散发出甜甜的香味。

phrasal_verbs.definition: if a window, door, or building gives onto a particular place, it leads to that place or you can see that place from it

examples.text: the garden gate that gives onto the main road
examples.translation: 面朝大路的花园大门

examples.text: a small balcony giving onto fields
examples.translation: 面向田地的小阳台

phrasal_verbs.definition: to give something to each person in a group

examples.text: Can you give the drinks out, please?
examples.translation: 请你把饮料分给大家好吗？

examples.text: Students were giving out leaflets to everyone on the street.
examples.translation: 学生们正在街上向每个人分发传单。

examples.text: Students were giving out leaflets to everyone on the street.
examples.translation: 学生们正在街上向每个人分发传单。

phrasal_verbs.definition: to stop doing or saying something that is annoying other people
phrasal_verbs.definition_cn: 停止〔做或说烦人的事情〕

examples.text: I wish you lot would just give over!
examples.translation: 你们这些家伙消停些好吗！

examples.text: Oh, give over complaining, we’re nearly there.
examples.translation: 噢﹐别发牢骚了﹐我们快到了。

examples.text: Oh, give over complaining, we’re nearly there.
examples.translation: 噢﹐别发牢骚了﹐我们快到了。

phrasal_verbs.definition: to be used for a particular purpose

examples.text: The land surrounding the village was given over to vineyards.
examples.translation: 村子周围的土地都用来做葡萄园。

examples.text: The whole day was given over to cooking and preparing for the celebrations.
examples.translation: 那一整天都在做饭菜和准备庆祝活动。

simple_forms.person: I, you, he, she, it, we, they
I, you, he, she, it, we, they

I, you, he, she, it, we, they

continuous_forms.person: I, you, he, she, it, we, they

I, you, he, she, it, we, they

thesaurus.topic: to give something to a group of people

entries.definition: to let someone have something, without expecting to be paid for it赠送﹐给予
examples: He was always giving me gifts.他总是送我礼物。
They gave a free drink to all their customers.他们给所有顾客都送一杯免费饮料。

entries.definition: to give money to an organization that helps people or protects something, or to give your blood or part of your body to save someone’s life捐赠﹐捐献
examples: The company donates 1 per cent of its profits to charity.这家公司把利润的1%捐赠给慈善机构。
70% of people wanted to donate their organs after death.有70%的人想要去世后捐献自己的器官。

entries.definition: to officially give money or a prize to someone奖励﹐授予
examples: She was awarded a million dollars in damages.她得到了一百万美元的损失赔偿。
Hollywood awarded him an Oscar for his performance.好莱坞给他颁发了奥斯卡表演奖。

entries.definition: to formally or officially give something to someone by putting it in their hands, especially at a formal ceremony〔尤指在正式典礼上〕颁发﹐授予
examples: They presented her with a bouquet of flowers.他们给她献上了一束花。

entries.definition: to officially arrange for someone to have something that you own after your death〔死后〕留给﹐遗赠
examples: He left most of his property to his wife.他把大部分财产都留给了妻子。

entries.word: lavish somebody with something/lavish something on somebody
entries.definition: to give someone a lot of something, especially praise, attention, or gifts给予某人大量某物
examples: After his team won, the press lavished him with praise.他的球队获胜之后﹐报界对他盛赞有加。

entries.definition: to give someone an honour, a university degree, or the right or power to do something授予﹐赋予〔荣誉﹑学位﹑权利或权力〕
examples: the powers conferred on him by Parliament议会授予他的权力
the highest honor that her country could confer on her

entries.definition: to give someone something to show how much they are respected, for example an honour, a title, or a gift – a very formal use
examples: He was also bestowed the title of ‘Cultural Ambassador of Grenada’.

entries.definition: to give something to each of the people in a group分发某物
examples: The teacher handed out the test papers.老师把测验卷子分发下去。
I’m going to give out some forms for you to fill in.

entries.definition: to give things to a large number of people, especially in the streets〔尤在街上〕散发
examples: Anti-war protesters were distributing leaflets.反战示威抗议者在散发传单。

senses.definition: the ability of a material or substance to bend or stretch when put under pressure

examples.text: The rope has quite a bit of give in it.
examples.translation: 这绳子相当有弹性。

extra_examples.text: This skirt doesn't have a lot of give to it.

There was hardly any give at all.
